context.arch.intelligibility
Class Explainer

java.lang.Object
  context.arch.intelligibility.Explainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
HmmExplainer, RulesExplainer, WekaExplainer
public abstract class Explainer
extends java.lang.Object

The Explainer class generates explanations of various question types from a Query. This provides default implementation for model-independent explanations (e.g. What, When, Inputs, Outputs), and descriptive explanations (through DescriptiveExplanationDelegate). This needs to be subclassed to implement model-dependent explanations (e.g. Why, Why Not, How To, Certainty).

See Also:
Query, DescriptiveExplainerDelegate

getExplanation

public Explanation getExplanation(Query query)
This is the main method to be used to get Explanations from explainers by supplying a Query. It should be extended by subclasses to support more types of question.

Parameters:
query - containing the question about a context regarding a certain time
Returns:
the generated Explanation corresponding to the Query

getWhatExplanation

public <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> Parameter<T> getWhatExplanation(java.lang.String context)
Get the current value of an attribute. This is normally the outcome value (i.e. of the output attribute), but may also refer to an input attribute, depending on the name of the context.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value of the context
Parameters:
context - to retrieve the value of, normally the outcome name (i.e. Enactor.getOutcomeName(), but may also be an input attribute name.
Returns:
Parameter where name is context, and value is of the context

getWhenExplanation

protected Parameter<java.util.Date> getWhenExplanation()
Get the timestamp of when the outcome value of the enactor was changed.

Returns:
Parameter where name is Widget.TIMESTAMP, and value is a java.util.Date

getWhatIfExplanation

public <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> Parameter<T> getWhatIfExplanation(Reason altInputs)
Get the outcome value if an alternative set of input values were provided instead of the current input values.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the outcome value
Parameters:
altInputs - conjunction of alternative input values to ask about
Returns:
Parameter where name is the outcome name, and value is the resulting outcome value.

getInputsExplanation

public Reason getInputsExplanation()
Get a conjunction of input values.

Returns:
conjunction of Parameters

getOutputsExplanation

public DNF getOutputsExplanation()
Get a DNF of all the possible output values.

Returns:
Disjunction of Reasons, where each Reason is of size one containing a Parameter for an outcome value, and all their names are the outcome name.

getDefinitionExplanation

public Parameter<java.lang.String> getDefinitionExplanation(java.lang.String attributeName)
Returns the descriptive definition of the context with name = attributeName. By default, this uses a DescriptionExplainerDelegate, but may be overridden.

Parameters:
attributeName - of the context to get its definition
Returns:
Parameter where name is attributeName and value is the definition.

getWhyExplanation

public abstract DNF getWhyExplanation()
Get why the enactor's model decided on its outcome value. This may be a reason trace, a probabilistic explanation, etc.

Returns:
DNF with one or more explanations.

getWhyNotExplanation

public abstract DNF getWhyNotExplanation(java.lang.String altOutcomeValue)
Get why the enactor's model did not decide on an alternative outcome value. This may be a reason trace, a probabilistic explanation, etc.

Parameters:
altOutcomeValue - the alternative outcome value to ask about
Returns:
DNF with one or more explanations.

getHowToExplanation

public abstract DNF getHowToExplanation(java.lang.String altOutcomeValue)
Get how the enactor's model would decide on a candidate outcome value. This may be a reason trace, a probabilistic explanation, etc.

Parameters:
altOutcomeValue - the candidate outcome value to ask about
Returns:
DNF with one or more explanations.

getCertaintyExplanation

public abstract DNF getCertaintyExplanation()
Get an explanation about how certain the enactor's model is of its decision.

Returns:
DNF with one or more explanations. The explanation may also be very simple with just one literal wrapped in a DNF.
